block.p: Jessica Parham Seessel, the daughter of Diane and Tom Seessel of Hopewell, N.J., was married yesterday to Richard James Larson, a son of Sheila Cullen of Dobbs Ferry, N.Y. Herbert Rosenberg, a retired Dobbs Ferry village justice and friend of the bridegroom, officiated in his home there. Later, Mr. Rosenberg led a celebration of the couple's marriage at the home of the bride's parents.

Ms. Seessel, 34, is keeping her name. In September she will begin teaching literature at Vanguard High School in Manhattan. Until last week she was a vice president and the national sales director at Columbia Artists Management in Manhattan, which represents classical musicians, dance companies and orchestras. She graduated from Dartmouth College and received a doctorate in modern thought and literature from Stanford University.

Jessica Parham Seessel, the daughter of Diane and Tom Seessel of Hopewell, N.J., was married yesterday to Richard James Larson, a son of Sheila Cullen of Dobbs Ferry, N.Y. Herbert Rosenberg, a retired Dobbs Ferry village justice and friend of the bridegroom, officiated in his home there. Later, Mr. Rosenberg led a celebration of the couple's marriage at the home of the bride's parents.

Ms. Seessel, 34, is keeping her name. In September she will begin teaching literature at Vanguard High School in Manhattan. Until last week she was a vice president and the national sales director at Columbia Artists Management in Manhattan, which represents classical musicians, dance companies and orchestras. She graduated from Dartmouth College and received a doctorate in modern thought and literature from Stanford University.
Her father retired as the chief executive of Seedco, a national nonprofit community development organization based in Manhattan. Her mother is a psychotherapist in Hopewell.

Mr. Larson, also 34, is the director of H.I.V. and AIDS programs at the Citizens Advice Bureau, a nonprofit community social service organization in the Bronx. He graduated from Hamilton College and received a master's degree in social work from Columbia University.
His mother is the office manager for an obstetrician and gynecologist in White Plains.
